column1: 21:00|"nine o'clock that night"|"'The driver put his hand in his mouth and whistled
column4: and went and sat behind him in the bus
column5: and that was the last I saw of him until nine o'clock that night
column6: when there's a scratching at the door. You guessed; after all that trouble
column7: he only decided to come and stay with me after all.'"|"Red Dog"|"Louis de Bernieres"

column1: 02:00|"two in the morning"|"'I picked him up once
column2: ' said Ellen. 'It was two in the morning
column3: 'cause I was picking my girl up from the disco. He wouldn't get out at Poon's Camp
column4: and then he wouldn't get out at Dampier mess
column5: and we were getting pretty tired and fed up
column6: I can tell you. Finally we took him to Hamersley Iron single-quarters
column7: and he hopped out. As he jumped out
column8: he did a really filthy smell
column9: like it was some kind of a thank-you!'"|"Red Dog"|"Louis de Bernieres"
